documents.document: @jbanal but a good question: why would you leave room for a higher degree in a diss like that?
@jbanal disappointing, but now that someone's made the phd joke I can rest easy.
@jbanal Ha. I think everything on the internet sounds like a snarky question to some people, maybe? Caught me by surprise! ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
@hs88_hs88 Thank you. I feel so helpless, as do many I'm sure. I can't believe what I'm seeing in the US. Appreciate your compassion.
@TerryGlavin Not sure why you get off on holding me up for mockery, but I know it made me feel small &stupid. Not everyone knows everything.
@TerryGlavin I asked you a question because I didn't know the answer & you were positioning as expert. Your response was snide, belittling.
Thread https://t.co/ZEm3nEl1O2
@TerryGlavin my partner is American, my MiL lives off a US pension. I've since found answers to my ? that aren't belittling. Peace.

@TerryGlavin @TorontoStar maybe you can provide some examples of how you think people *can* effectively resist then?

40. And to #bellletstalk : make educating & advocating for long-term mental health care a priority. That's how you get rid of the "stigma."
39. There is hope. I'm here, tweeting & alive! To those coming to grips with mental illness: demand a long-term care plan from your doctor.
38. if you're asking ppl to confront their mental health issues, you ought to be first be honest with them about how hard finding care is.
37. and that serious conversations about mental health have to acknowledge the serious need for funded long term outpatient care. Because,
36. I did not intend to discredit medication or physicians. Only to say that are a tiny piece of the puzzle in any long-term care plan.
